column2: VERMONT DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Vermont

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column4: low beam headlights.
column8: high beam headlights.

column2: 2. As long as you donâ€™t leave the road, you may legally pass a vehicle on the right:
column4: Only during daylight hours.
column8: if you are on a two-lane, two-way road and the other vehicle is turning left.
column10: when you are turning into a one-way street with no oncoming traffic.

column2: 3. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column4: speed up.
column8: use your brake lights.
column10: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead.
column6: The road will curve to the right.
column8: Do not turn right.
column10: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 5. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a low place in the road.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: One-way traffic
column8: Sharp curves ahead

column2: 7. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 8. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: wear approved helmets.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 9. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: number of cars in front of you.
column8: number of cars behind you.
column10: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.

column2: 10. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 11. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.
column8: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column10: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.

column2: 12. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 13. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: avoid making eye contact.
column6: slow down or move over safely.
column8: distance yourself from the situation.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: There is a traffic signal ahead
column8: Railroad crossing ahead

column2: 15. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column8: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 16. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: drive as they would on dry roads.
column8: use alternate routes.

column2: 17. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: The same as a steady yellow light.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 18. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Multiple Turns
column8: Pedestrian Crossing

column2: 20. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: stop and wait for the light to change.
column6: proceed with caution through the intersection.
column8: speed up to beat the red light.
column10: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
